summary: Build a number information website that fetches and displays data from https://source-code-api.vercel.app/?num={number}.
architectural_notes: Use https://source-code-api.vercel.app/?num={number} as the backend data source for number information.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page number information website where a user can enter a number and trigger a fetch to the API endpoint https://source-code-api.vercel.app/?num={number}.
Display the API response for the requested number in a readable format, including clear loading and error states.
Use React Query for API requests and caching keyed by the input number to avoid unnecessary refetches for the same number.
Apply a coherent visual theme and layout for the number information site (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and use it consistently across the page.

Update the UI to use a dark, terminal/hacker-inspired visual style across the entire page (backgrounds, cards, inputs, buttons, headers, and result panel), including terminal-like typography (monospace for key areas) and high-contrast accents, while keeping all user-facing text in English.

Add a theme toggle control (Dark/Light) that switches the app between dark and light modes by applying/removing the global dark-mode class, and persist the userâ€™s choice locally so it is restored on page reload.
Add an on-page search history of previously submitted numbers that allows quick re-running a past search; persist this history locally, cap the list length, and provide a clear-history action.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a number information website that uses the API endpoint https://source-code-api.vercel.app/?num={number} to fetch and display number details.
Add a dark theme and update the UI styling to have a "hacker" feel (e.g., terminal-like typography/colors).
Add a history of previously searched numbers on the page for quick access/repeat searches.
